poem:
Starvation's Echo  
  
In Gaza's dusk, whispers of unsaid cries,  
a child's fist clenches the empty bowl—  
silent testimonies to the hollowed night.  
Beyond the wire, the world slumbers,  
and in its dreams, Palestinians fade,  
their echoes barely heard,  
a plea wrapped in silence,   
as blood-stained hands turn pages.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Joe Biden is complicit in Gaza’s starvation. Blood is on his hands | Mohamad Bazzi In March 2024, the global authority on food security warned that Palestinians were experiencing “catastrophic levels of hunger”, and famine was imminent in northern Gaza as Israel continued its siege of the territory. That report was one of the most direct warnings from the UN and international relief groups, which had been raising alarms about the potential for widespread starvation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Joe Biden is complicit in Gaza’s starvation. Blood is on his hands | Mohamad Bazzi In March 2024, the global authority on food security warned that Palestinians were experiencing “catastrophic levels of hunger”, and famine was imminent in northern Gaza as Israel continued its siege of the territory. That report was one of the most direct warnings from the UN and international relief groups, which had been raising alarms about the potential for widespread starvation
